RESTful 手册

 

RESTful

话题列表

  • http methods (5)
    • How do I know which HTTP methods are supported
    • When to use PUT or POST
    • When to use the PATCH method
    • What are idempotent and/or safe methods?
    • When to send 4xx or 5xx codes
  • basics (5)
    • How do I let users log into my RESTful API?
    • Caching your REST API
    • How do I version my REST API?
    • What is HATEOAS and why is it important?
    • What is the code-on-demand constraint?
  • resources (4)
    • Custom content-types
    • Paginating collections
    • Using link-types in relations
    • Asynchronous operations
  • miscellaneous (3)
    • What is the Richardson Maturity Model?
    • Are REST and HTTP the same thing?
    • Where to find REST presentations
  • http headers (1)
    • Unsatisfied Accept-Language header
  • mediatypes (1)
    • Is my API RESTful when I use JSON?
 

Where can we find REST presentations?

There are many (good) presentations about REST and HTTP out there. Most of these can be found on local meetups or development conferences all over the world. See below for some of the slides of these presentations.

See also

  • Fielding Dissertation: CHAPTER 5: Representational State Transfer (REST)
  • Joshua Thijssen - REST in practice
  • Ben Longden - REST and the hypermedia constraint
  • David Zuelke - Designing HTTP interfaces and RESTful web services
  • Markus Lanthaler - Building Next-Generation Web APIs with JSON-LD and Hydra (video)
  • Ross Tuck - HTTP and your angry dog
  • Abdelmonaim Remani - How RESTful is your REST
  • Markus Lanthaler - Model Your Application Domain, Not Your JSON Structures
